resources.string: The name of the museum is after the founder of Bangalore city Yelahanka Chieftain Kempegowda and is situated on the first floor of Mayo Hall. The enticing glass floor with an 18th-century map that runs throughout is one of the enticing features of the museum and second being the fiberglass statue of Kempe Gowda in the center of the museum. It is an interesting place to visit for the archeology and history buffs as it exhibits paintings and statue of the time when Kempe Gowda actually initiated the foundation or the blueprint of the town, the four towers which marked the boundary of the city with various old names for the places which are recognized differently today. Location: Field Marshal Cariappa Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001 Best Time to Visit: Anytime during the day, avoid visiting on a weekend. Price: INR 50 for adults and INR 30 for students. Timings: Opens from 10 AM to 5 PM on all days of the week except Saturdays and Sundays. Average time required to visit the place: 1 to 2 hours. Distance from Kempe Gowda Bus stand: Approximately 7 KM.

At a distance of 5 Kms from Bangalore City Railway Station, Fun World is an innovative theme park located on Palace Grounds. Spread over an area of 12 acres, it is among ideal places of interest for children in Bangalore. The park is designed on the lines of Disney Land and is equipped with a wide range of rides. This is one of the oldest amusement parks in Bangalore city. The rides like Atlanta Roller Coater, Caterpillar Rides, Rounded Train, Toy Rides etc are safe and provide lots of excitement for children. Visit to Fun World is one of the top things to do in Bangalore. Timings: 11 AM to 9.30 PM on all days. Entrance fee - Rs. 200 on weekday and Rs. 250 on weekend.

At a distance of 3.5 Kms from Bangalore City Railway Station, Indira Gandhi Musical Fountain Park is situated opposite to the Nehru Planetarium. Inaugurated in 1995, it is the first computerized fountain in India and also an ideal sightseeing place in Bangalore to visit in the evening. Spread over 17 acres, the park was created by the BNA Technology Consulting Ltd, Hong Kong. The park is equipped with latest multimedia technology and fitted with 1000 nozzles, it has 15 formations and 27 combinations of fountains. The visual delight of the light and sound show together with the synchronized rhythmic dancing of fountains provides high visual treat. The distinct patterns formed by the musical fountain are projected into a big screen using a twin projector. Laser show is also performed here. The shows are held every evening at 7 PM and 8 PM for 30 minutes each. Closed on Mondays and second Tuesdays.

At a distance of 5 Kms from Bangalore City Railway Station, Cariappa Memorial Park is situated in a portion of the parade ground between MG Road and Cubbon road. Spread over 22 acres, it is one of the famous parks in Bangalore. Established in 1996, it was laid in the memory of Field Marshall KM Cariappa who served Indian Army. The park has a small waterfall with a pond which attracts a lot of birds. The park has an entrance plaza and a seven feet monolithic monument of Cariappa. Six military bands perform every fortnight. The grassy dunes around the bandstand provide comfortable seating for the public. The garden is maintained by various divisions of the Army. About 3000 species of plants and trees both indigenous and imported can be found here. The park has a play area for kids. Timings: Week days - 5:30 - 8 PM, Saturdays - 1 - 7 PM Sundays - 9 AM - 7 PM.

At a distance of 26 Kms from Bangalore (towards Ramanagaram), Wonder La is an amusement park situated on Bangalore - Mysore Express way. It is India\'s biggest amusement and water park and also one of the most visited among Bangalore tourist places. Spread over 82 acres, the park offers over 50 kinds of rides - water sports and open rides. Attractions include musical fountain and laser show, virtual reality show, high thrill rides, kids\'s rides, heated wave pools, and numerous water rides. The Hurricane, Maverick, Wonder Splash, Techno Jump, Drop Zone rides are famous. Recently added Rain Disco, with 10,000 watts of hi-fidelity sound is a special attraction. Wonderla offers Regular Tickets and Fastrack Tickets. Fastrack Tickets allows visitors to enjoy the rides with a shorter queue and the tickets are limited to 500 numbers in a day. Timings: Monday to Friday - 11 AM to 6 PM. Saturday, Sunday Holidays - 11 AM to 7 PM.
